question:
(a) On a sketch map of Nigeria locate and name any four vegetation belts

(b) Highlight four ways in which the forest vegetation contributes to the economy of the country

(c) Outline any four problems associated with the exploitation of the forest vegetation.
answer:
(b) Four ways in which the forest vegetation contributes to the economy of the country are:

(i) Provision of timber for construction of houses and furniture

(ii) Provision of foreign exchange earnings from the export of timber 

(iii) Forest vegetation provides jobs to many people, e.g forest guards, lumbermen

(iv) Forest vegetation also provides medicinal herbs for the pharmaceutical industries.

(c) Four problems associated with exploitation of forest vegetation include:

(i) Heterogeneous nature of trees

(ii) Lack of motorable roads

(iii) High cost of survey to determine economic trees

(iv) Felling of timber is risky as many people have lost their lives in the process

question:
(a) Draw a sketch map of Nigeria and on it, locate and name

(i) three major zones of modern manufacturing industries

(ii) two important towns within each zone

(b) Outline any three problems which result from the concentration of manufacturing industries in these zones

(c) Suggest three steps which can be taken to encourage the growth of industries outside these zones.
answer:
(b) Three problems which result from the concentration of manufacturing industries in these zones are:

(i) Industrial and air pollution

(ii) Competition resulting in lower prices of goods

(iii) High pressure on existing social amenities like electricity, water, etc

(c) Three steps that can be taken to encourage the growth of industries outside these zones are:

(i) Provision of electricity, water, healthcare outside these zones

(ii) Granting of loans to entrepreneurs who want to build industries outside these zones

(iii) Granting of free land and long tax holiday to industries sited outside these zones.

question:
(a) On an outline map of West Africa, show
(i) one area having less than four months of rainfall annually
(ii) one area having rainfall all the year round
(iii) the position of the high pressure belt in January

(b) Give three reasons for the length of the rainy season in (a)(i) above

(c) Explain three problems that rainfall may pose to agriculture in (a) (ii) above
answer:
(b) Three reasons for the length of rainy season in the area having less than four months or rain annually.

(i) Long distance from the ocean. The area is too far from the ocean

(ii) Nearness to the desert. The area is very close to the sahara desert, hence it experiences low rainfall.

(iii) Effects of trade winds. The N. E trade winds tend to have more influence on the area than the S.E trade winds.

(c) Three problems due tc continuous rainfall all the year round are:

(i) Soil erosion: Too much rain results in soil erosion

(ii) Leaching: Too much rain leads to loss of nutrients from the surface of the soil

(iii) Poor yield of crops due to either damage to the crop or lack of sufficient sunshine to produce fruits.

question:
(a) On an outline map of West Africa, locate and name
(i) two ECOWAS member countries along the coast
(ii) two ECOWAS member countries in the interior
(iii) the capital of each of the countries

(b) Describe six benefits which any one of the countries shown on your map derives from its membership of the ECOWAS
answer:
(b) Six benefits Liberia derives from its membership of the ECOWAS:

(i) There has been increase in trade between Liberia and other ECOWAS members

(ii) Liberia was once involved in civil war but is now a peaceful country through the effort of ECOMOG

(iii) Free movement of Liberians within the sub-region has fostered unity and cooperation between Liberia and others

(iv) Road development between Liberia and her neighbours has helped in the transport network of Liberia

(v) Border dispute between Liberia and Sierra Leone has been settled by ECOWAS members

(vi) Liberia's participation in ECOWAS games held in Lagos in 1977 aided understanding and solidarity among the states.

question:
(a) On an outline map of West Africa, show:
(i) one area each in a different country, important for diamond, petroleum and gold
(ii) one important town in each area
(iii) one route from the producing area to the port of export for each mineral

(b) Describe one method of mining any one of the minerals in (a) above

(c) Highlight four problems associated with mining in West Africa
answer:
(b) One method of mining petroleum is drilling:

(i) The underground rocks are sampled and tested for traces of oil

(ii) When oil is discovered, a well is sunk to reach it by the help of a drilling rig or derrick

(iii) The oil is then pumped out

(iv) A system of valves called "Christmas tree" is created to control the flow into tanks

(c) Four problems associated with mining in West Africa; 

(i) Lack of fund

(ii) Lack of technical know-how

(iii) Absence of minerals

(iv) Lack of sources of efficient and reliable power
